newsitem.title: USA: Walgreen August same-store sales up.
newsitem.headline: Walgreen August same-store sales up.

text.p: Walgreen Co said same-store sales for August were up 9.7 percent.
Total sales for the month were $1 billion, compared to year-ago sales of $877.7 million, the retailer said.
Pharmacy sales, which account for 43 percent of overall sales, increased 16.5 percent. Same-store pharmacy sales were up 11 percent.
Calendar year-to-date sales were $7.82 billion, up 14.1 percent from $6.85 billion in 1995, Walgreen said.
Fiscal year-to-date sales for 1996 finished at $11.78 billion, up 13.3 percent from $10.39 billion. Same-store sales for the fiscal year were up 8.5 percent.
As of August 31, Walgreen operated 2,193 drugstores in 35 states and Puerto Rico, compared to 2,085 a year ago.
Same-store figures compare sales for stores open at least a year, the company said.
